stage.welcome_msg:
Welcome to Round 3!
Same questions as before will appear, with the addition of Identification questions. They're not case sensitive, but please check your spelling :)
Questions will appear automatically.

identification.q: In computing, this is a set of data processing elements connected in a series so that the output of one element is the input of the next one, and the elements are often executed in parallel or with time-slicing.
In Java, what is the largest positive value than an int (32-bit signed integer) can hold?
What does IBM (the multinational computer technology and IT consulting corporation) stand for?

choose.q: Who coined the term "Silicon Valley", referring to the high-tech businesses in the southern part of the San Francisco Bay Area?

identification.q: Also known as "phlashing", what does PDoS stand for?

This Irish company, acquired by Intel Corporation, is known for its physics engine bearing the same name. The said engine was designed for computer and video games and uses dynamical simulation, allowing more lifelike worlds and animation such as ragdoll physics and intelligence in massive falling objects.

choose.q: This procedural texture primitive of function, widely used for visual effects like smoke, fire and clouds, was invented for the 1982 movie, Tron.

identification.q: What does FSF (a non-profit corporation founded by Richard Stallman on October 4, 1985) stand for?

choose.q: In 2008, at the 59th Annual Technology & Engineering Emmy Awards, the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences presented the Award/s for Handheld Game Device Display Screen Innovation to which company/s?

identification.q: What does KDD (a data mining branch or process, name coined by Gregory Piatetsky-Shapiro in 1989) stand for?
What is the name of the rendering engine behind the Safari browser?
PHP is a popular scripting language used to create dynamic web pages. What does PHP stand for? (The answer is "PHP: ___________.")

choose.q: What do you call the method of fraudently trying to acquire information, most commonly done through a seemingly legitimate email?
Who is the creator of the Ruby Programming Language?

identification.q: What is the name of the network created by the US Department of Defense?s Advanced Research Projects Agency which eventually became the Internet?
How many Kilobytes are there in a Gigabyte?
In the IEEE standard for floating point arithmetic (IEEE 754), how many bits are used to store the significand in a 32-bit floating point number?

choose.q: Who is the creator of the TeX typesetting system?

identification.q: What is the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number BEEF?

choose.q: For the Free Software Foundation, what does “free” in “free software” mean?
Which musical format stores information like notes, tempo and sequence, rather than actual audio samples?

identification.q: On the command-line for Windows, what command lists the contents of the current directory?

choose.q: Which is currently the computer language of choice for extremely large game development projects?
Which if the following are Linux distributions?

identification.q: In Linux, what is a background application called?

choose.q: Which company currently owns the Qt GUI Framework?
